knimeNode.name: Kolmogorov Smirnov Test
knimeNode.shortDescription: States whether two samples come from the same distribution

intro.p: The two-sample Kolmogorov-Smirnov test is used to detect if two samples come from the same underlying distribution. More precisely, this non-parametric test calculates a distance d between the empirical distribution functions of the two samples.

The corresponding p-value can be computed exactly if there are no ties present in the samples and the product of the two sample sizes is less than 10000. Otherwise the p-value has to be approximated by determining a convergence of a sum with the given options.

With the given significance level α, a corresponding p-value (null hypothesis H0: the two samples come from a common distribution, alternative hypothesis HA: the two samples do not come from a common distribution) can be given.
Please refer also to the Wikipedia description of the Kolmogorov-Smirnov Test.
